abstract: Seeking an Exit From Uranium | Citi, Rewriting the Rules | Bausch & Lomb Is Sold for $8.7 Billion | Club Med’s Future
snippet: Seeking an Exit From Uranium | Citi, Rewriting the Rules | Bausch & Lomb Is Sold for $8.7 Billion | Club Med’s Future
lead_paragraph: The world leader in uranium enrichment, Urenco, is plumply profitable and has at least 10 years of steady work lined up. So why is it up for sale?

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Mark Scott
